channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uneven surface and overgrown vegetation, 31st October
item.description:
Today a group of volunteers among with myself (Councillor Sarah Hands, Tewkesbury Borough Council) spent two hours clearing as much vegetation from this alley as possible as it had become impassible. I would like to see the county council finish the job. The path is extremely uneven with a lot of it taken over by soil and broken away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lampost no 5 Sandy Lane by bus stop foliage blocking it, 31st October
item.description:
The No 5 lamppost on Sandy Lane by the bus stop has branches and leaves blocking the full light when street light is on
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Sandy Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pothole, 31st October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Conway Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 31st October
item.description:
email rec 31/10/2023 Dear Sir or Madam My wife and I are in the process of refurbishing the above property, which we bought last autumn. We have discovered serious levels of moisture penetrating the north wall, being that facing the highway (Old Gloucester Road). The level of the carriageway and public footpath is significantly higher than that of the internal ground-floor. There is no land between the curtilage of the property and the highway, such that the tarmac footpath directly abuts the north wall. I am concerned that the surface water drainage or other pipework might have failed, leading to the subsoil beneath the highway and footpath becoming saturated. Whatever the underlying cause of the dampness, it will need to be remedied in order to prevent mould and other risks injurious to health. I look forward to hearing from you. Yours faithfully
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red Pedestrian and Vehicle lights out at SW corner of junction., 31st October
item.description:
Some lights have blown at this location. Red pedestrian and vehicle bulbs out at SW corner of junction of Fairview Rd and Winchcombe St. Also, I believe that some of the bulbs in the pedestrian crossing push buttons are also out, or the buttons are not working. I am not convinced that the pedestrian crossing activates when some of the buttons at this junction are pressed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairview Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are at least 5 drains blocked on Gloucester Road Andoversford between Crossfields and Coronation Square, 30th October
item.description:
What three words locations: ///decking.airliners.boom ///blissful.assets.craters ///unfit.person.earmarked ///perfectly.competing.chimp ///euphoric.showcase.overt These drains are full to the brim with silt and need digging out. Rain water floods the road lower down by the Royal Oak because it can’t get into these drains. Only the action of residents pulling up covers lower down prevent properties from flooding

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
